intro: Cacalia senecioides, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as woodland edges and wet meadows. Cacalia senecioides is also known for its milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Cacalia.
